intro: Cirsium albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower thistle, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and large, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has deeply lobed, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Cirsium albiflorum is often found in open areas where it can spread through its persistent seeds and rhizomes.
